nodes.text: That's a fine-looking chest. I'd take it for myself if it wasn't obviously so heavy...
... and if I thought I could get away with it.
... and if I wasn't worried that I might catch zombieness from it.
Let's see if I can open this thing.
Locked, of course.
Nothing left in the chest to take.
Uck! This looks complicated. It looks like a Marlowe class with the delicate thingamajiggy and the multiple cylinders.
I can tell it's going to be a pain to open, but I guess I need to really work at my lock recognition skills.
It's a tricky sort of lock. I definitely need a houdini to open it - and a lot of skill.
Yikes! This is a nasty-looking lock. I've never opened one that was this complex!
It may be beyond my lockpicking abilities right now.
Let's see if I can get this.
Tricky, but I got it!
I guess I need more practice. A lot more practice.
... would you believe I don't have ANY lockpicks? Dang.
Maybe the Captain's Skeleton Key will work on this chest...
It fits!
Nothing left in here but rust.
So what do we have inside this pirate chest?
Looks like a belt, potions, and a ring along with many coins.
The belt is a pair of suspenders...
Suspenders with Panda patterns on it.
Do you suppose that the Captain has a thing for pandas?
There's definitely some magic worked into these suspenders...
Wearing these suspenders will improve my ability to defend myself - particularly against pandas!
Maybe if I wore something over them, they wouldn't look so obnoxious.
Ah, a couple of Healing Potions...
Okay, now let's look at the ring...
It's a "One and Only" Ring... the sort of gift you give to the one person you really love.
Ah, last but not least, a nice collection of Lyra to take with me as a souvenir of my victory here.
